applySlotConfigSlot(resourceGroupName, name, slotSwapEntity, slot, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Applies the configuration settings from the target slot onto the current slot

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
slotSwapEntity object

Request body that contains the target slot
name. Settings from that slot will be applied on the source slot

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
targetSlot string <optional>

Set the destination deployment
slot during swap operation
preserveVnet boolean <optional>

Get or set the flag
indicating it should preserve VNet to the slot during swap
slot string

Name of the source slot. Settings from the target slot
will be applied onto this slot
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

backupSite(resourceGroupName, name, request, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Creates web app backup

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
request object

Information on backup request

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
backupRequestName string <optional>

Name of the backup
enabled boolean <optional>

True if the backup schedule is enabled
(must be included in that case), false if the backup schedule should be
disabled
storageAccountUrl string <optional>

SAS URL to the container
backupSchedule object <optional>

Schedule for the backup if it is
executed periodically

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
frequencyInterval number <optional>

How often should
be the backup executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to 7
and FrequencyUnit should be set to Day)
frequencyUnit string <optional>

How often should be
the backup executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to Day and
FrequencyInterval should be set to 7). Possible values include: 'Day',
'Hour'
keepAtLeastOneBackup boolean <optional>

True if the
retention policy should always keep at least one backup in the storage
account, regardless how old it is; false otherwise.
retentionPeriodInDays number <optional>

After how
many days backups should be deleted
startTime date <optional>

When the schedule should
start working
lastExecutionTime date <optional>

The last time when
this schedule was triggered
databases array <optional>

Databases included in the backup
backupRequestType string <optional>

Type of the backup. Possible
values include: 'Default', 'Clone', 'Relocation'
id string <optional>

Resource Id
name string <optional>

Resource Name
location string <optional>

Resource Location
type string <optional>

Resource type
tags object <optional>

Resource tags
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function

Discovers existing web app backups that can be restored

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
request object

Information on restore request

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
storageAccountUrl string <optional>

SAS URL to the container
blobName string <optional>

Name of a blob which contains the backup
overwrite boolean <optional>

True if the restore operation can
overwrite target site. "True" needed if trying to restore over an existing
site.
siteName string <optional>

Name of a site (Web App)
databases array <optional>

Collection of databses which should be
restored. This list has to match the list of databases included in the
backup.
ignoreConflictingHostNames boolean <optional>

Changes a logic when
restoring a site with custom domains. If "true", custom domains are
removed automatically. If "false", custom domains are added to
the site object when it is being restored, but that might fail
due to conflicts during the operation.
operationType string <optional>

Operation type. Possible values
include: 'Default', 'Clone', 'Relocation'
adjustConnectionStrings boolean <optional>

Gets or sets a flag
showing if SiteConfig.ConnectionStrings should be set in new site
hostingEnvironment string <optional>

App Service Environment name,
if needed (only when restoring a site to an App Service Environment)
id string <optional>

Resource Id
name string <optional>

Resource Name
location string <optional>

Resource Location
type string <optional>

Resource type
tags object <optional>

Resource tags
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Name Type Attributes Description
customHeaders object <optional>

getSiteBackupStatusSecrets(resourceGroupName, name, backupId, request, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Gets status of a web app backup that may be in progress, including secrets associated with the backup, such as the Azure Storage SAS URL. Also can be used to update the SAS URL for the backup if a new URL is passed in the request body.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
backupId string

Id of backup
request object

Information on backup request

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
backupRequestName string <optional>

Name of the backup
enabled boolean <optional>

True if the backup schedule is enabled
(must be included in that case), false if the backup schedule should be
disabled
storageAccountUrl string <optional>

SAS URL to the container
backupSchedule object <optional>

Schedule for the backup if it is
executed periodically

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
frequencyInterval number <optional>

How often should
be the backup executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to 7
and FrequencyUnit should be set to Day)
frequencyUnit string <optional>

How often should be
the backup executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to Day and
FrequencyInterval should be set to 7). Possible values include: 'Day',
'Hour'
keepAtLeastOneBackup boolean <optional>

True if the
retention policy should always keep at least one backup in the storage
account, regardless how old it is; false otherwise.
retentionPeriodInDays number <optional>

After how
many days backups should be deleted
startTime date <optional>

When the schedule should
start working
lastExecutionTime date <optional>

The last time when
this schedule was triggered
databases array <optional>

Databases included in the backup
backupRequestType string <optional>

Type of the backup. Possible
values include: 'Default', 'Clone', 'Relocation'
id string <optional>

Resource Id
name string <optional>

Resource Name
location string <optional>

Resource Location
type string <optional>

Resource type
tags object <optional>

Resource tags
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function

  • operations/sites.js, line 21302

restoreSite(resourceGroupName, name, backupId, request, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Restores a web app

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
backupId string

Id of backup to restore
request object

Information on restore request

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
storageAccountUrl string <optional>

SAS URL to the container
blobName string <optional>

Name of a blob which contains the backup
overwrite boolean <optional>

True if the restore operation can
overwrite target site. "True" needed if trying to restore over an existing
site.
siteName string <optional>

Name of a site (Web App)
databases array <optional>

Collection of databses which should be
restored. This list has to match the list of databases included in the
backup.
ignoreConflictingHostNames boolean <optional>

Changes a logic when
restoring a site with custom domains. If "true", custom domains are
removed automatically. If "false", custom domains are added to
the site object when it is being restored, but that might fail
due to conflicts during the operation.
operationType string <optional>

Operation type. Possible values
include: 'Default', 'Clone', 'Relocation'
adjustConnectionStrings boolean <optional>

Gets or sets a flag
showing if SiteConfig.ConnectionStrings should be set in new site
hostingEnvironment string <optional>

App Service Environment name,
if needed (only when restoring a site to an App Service Environment)
id string <optional>

name string <optional>

Resource Name
location string <optional>

Resource Location
type string <optional>

Resource type
tags object <optional>

updateSiteAuthSettings(resourceGroupName, name, siteAuthSettings, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Updates the Authentication / Authorization settings associated with web app

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
siteAuthSettings object

Auth settings associated with web app

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
enabled boolean <optional>

Gets or sets a value indicating
whether the Authentication / Authorization feature is enabled for the
current app.
httpApiPrefixPath string <optional>

Gets or sets the
relative path prefix used by platform HTTP APIs.
Changing this value is not recommended except for compatibility
reasons.
unauthenticatedClientAction string <optional>

Gets or sets
the action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the
app. Possible values include: 'RedirectToLoginPage', 'AllowAnonymous'
tokenStoreEnabled boolean <optional>

Gets or sets a value
indicating whether to durably store platform-specific security tokens
obtained during login flows. This capability is disabled by
default.
allowedExternalRedirectUrls array <optional>

Gets or sets
a collection of external URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging
in
or logging out of the web app. Note that the query string part
of the URL is ignored.
This is an advanced setting typically only needed by Windows
Store application backends.
Note that URLs within the current domain are always implicitly
allowed.
defaultProvider string <optional>

Gets or sets the default
authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured.
This setting is only needed if multiple providers are
configured and the unauthenticated client
action is set to "RedirectToLoginPage". Possible values
include: 'AzureActiveDirectory', 'Facebook', 'Google', 'MicrosoftAccount',
'Twitter'
clientId string <optional>

Gets or sets the Client ID of
this relying party application, known as the client_id.
This setting is required for enabling OpenID Connection
authentication with Azure Active Directory or
other 3rd party OpenID Connect providers.
More information on OpenID Connect:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
clientSecret string <optional>

Gets or sets the Client
Secret of this relying party application (in Azure Active Directory, this
is also referred to as the Key).
This setting is optional. If no client secret is configured,
the OpenID Connect implicit auth flow is used to authenticate end users.
Otherwise, the OpenID Connect Authorization Code Flow is used
to authenticate end users.
More information on OpenID Connect:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
issuer string <optional>

Gets or sets the OpenID Connect
Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this
application.
When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the
directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.
This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.
More information on OpenID Connect Discovery:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html
allowedAudiences array <optional>

Gets or sets a list of
allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by
Azure Active Directory. Note that the
{Microsoft.Web.Hosting.Administration.SiteAuthSettings.ClientId} value is
always considered an
allowed audience, regardless of this setting.
additionalLoginParams array <optional>

Gets or sets a list
of login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint
when
a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".
aadClientId string <optional>
openIdIssuer string <optional>
googleClientId string <optional>

Gets or sets the OpenID
Connect Client ID for the Google web application.
This setting is required for enabling Google Sign-In.
Google Sign-In documentation:
https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/
googleClientSecret string <optional>

Gets or sets the
client secret associated with the Google web application.
This setting is required for enabling Google Sign-In.
Google Sign-In documentation:
https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/
googleOAuthScopes array <optional>

Gets or sets the OAuth
2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Google Sign-In
authentication.
This setting is optional. If not specified, "openid",
"profile", and "email" are used as default scopes.
Google Sign-In documentation:
https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/
facebookAppId string <optional>

Gets or sets the App ID of
the Facebook app used for login.
This setting is required for enabling Facebook Login.
Facebook Login documentation:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login
facebookAppSecret string <optional>

Gets or sets the App
Secret of the Facebook app used for Facebook Login.
This setting is required for enabling Facebook Login.
Facebook Login documentation:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login
facebookOAuthScopes array <optional>

Gets or sets the
OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Facebook Login
authentication.
This setting is optional.
Facebook Login documentation:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login
twitterConsumerKey string <optional>

Gets or sets the
OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in.
This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In.
Twitter Sign-In documentation:
https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in
twitterConsumerSecret string <optional>

Gets or sets the
OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in.
This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In.
Twitter Sign-In documentation:
https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in
microsoftAccountClientId string <optional>

Gets or sets
the OAuth 2.0 client ID that was created for the app used for
authentication.
This setting is required for enabling Microsoft Account
authentication.
Microsoft Account OAuth documentation:
https://dev.onedrive.com/auth/msa_oauth.htm
microsoftAccountClientSecret string <optional>

Gets or
sets the OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for
authentication.
This setting is required for enabling Microsoft Account

Updates the Authentication / Authorization settings associated with web app

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description

Name of resource group
name string

Name of web app
siteAuthSettings object

Auth settings associated with web app

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
enabled boolean <optional>

Gets or sets a value indicating
whether the Authentication / Authorization feature is enabled for the
current app.
httpApiPrefixPath string <optional>

Gets or sets the
relative path prefix used by platform HTTP APIs.
Changing this value is not recommended except for compatibility
reasons.
unauthenticatedClientAction string <optional>

Gets or sets
the action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the
app. Possible values include: 'RedirectToLoginPage', 'AllowAnonymous'
tokenStoreEnabled boolean <optional>

Gets or sets a value
indicating whether to durably store platform-specific security tokens
obtained during login flows. This capability is disabled by
default.
allowedExternalRedirectUrls array <optional>

Gets or sets
a collection of external URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging
in
or logging out of the web app. Note that the query string part
of the URL is ignored.
This is an advanced setting typically only needed by Windows
Store application backends.
Note that URLs within the current domain are always implicitly
allowed.
defaultProvider string <optional>

Gets or sets the default
authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured.
This setting is only needed if multiple providers are
configured and the unauthenticated client
action is set to "RedirectToLoginPage". Possible values
include: 'AzureActiveDirectory', 'Facebook', 'Google', 'MicrosoftAccount',
'Twitter'
clientId string <optional>

Gets or sets the Client ID of
this relying party application, known as the client_id.
This setting is required for enabling OpenID Connection
authentication with Azure Active Directory or
other 3rd party OpenID Connect providers.
More information on OpenID Connect:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
clientSecret string <optional>

Gets or sets the Client
Secret of this relying party application (in Azure Active Directory, this
is also referred to as the Key).
This setting is optional. If no client secret is configured,
the OpenID Connect implicit auth flow is used to authenticate end users.
Otherwise, the OpenID Connect Authorization Code Flow is used
to authenticate end users.
More information on OpenID Connect:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html
issuer string <optional>

Gets or sets the OpenID Connect
Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this
application.
When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the
directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.
This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.
More information on OpenID Connect Discovery:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html
allowedAudiences array <optional>

Gets or sets a list of
allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by
Azure Active Directory. Note that the
{Microsoft.Web.Hosting.Administration.SiteAuthSettings.ClientId} value is
always considered an
allowed audience, regardless of this setting.
additionalLoginParams array <optional>

Gets or sets a list
of login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint
when
a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".
aadClientId string <optional>
openIdIssuer string <optional>

https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/
